main event: On 7 February 1953, three unidentified flying objects were observed near Hakodate, Hokkaido, Japan, by approximately 15 persons including Japanese police.
interesting points: The objects were round and fluorescent white, measuring about 20-30 feet in diameter., They were observed flying in a circular pattern at an estimated altitude of 2000-3000 feet for approximately 15 minutes., The objects emitted no sound and showed no means of propulsion., Their movement was described as erratic, with hovering and abrupt changes of direction., After about 15 minutes, the objects flew out of sight in a northerly direction at a high rate of speed.
witness description: Included Japanese police and civilians in the area.
